item.title: Concerning the Advantage of Studying Abroad in the Cultivation of Moral Merit
item.description: It is sometimes argued that the pursuit of study and the practice of residence in foreign lands are neither necessary nor expedient. Yet I maintain the opinion that there is at least one practical and indispensable motive to undertake such sojourns. For when one sets foot upon alien soil, he finds him self released from the familiar obligation that binds him in homeland: the subtle competition among domestic peers, the tacit expectation from local communities and the subtle ties of lineage. In this novel milieu, the traveler enjoys a latitude of action and reflection heretofore denied, for the intricate web of precedent connections is temporarily suspended. Though at first this freedom may feel unsettling — like a mariner cast adrift upon uncharted seas — he soon discovers in which the opportunity to reforge alliances and to cultivate new connections upon the firmer ground of deliberate choice rather than mere inheritance.

item.title: Work-Life Balance Tips for Phd Student
item.description:
Resources:
https://www.rochester.edu/college/learningcenter/studying/blog/2024-10-18-achieving-work-life-balance-as-a-phd-student.html

Time Management

  • Prioritizing

Mental Health

  • Meditation, reading for pleasure, spending time in nature
  • Social?

Physical Health

  • 30 minutes of walking
  • Adequate Sleep
  • Healthy Eating Habits
    • Boiled Spaghetti Bolognese With Vegetables and Cheese
    • Steak
    • Jiaozi/Ravioli
    • Brown rice(Time-consuming)
    • Cheese Bread + Milk + Egg

item.title: Ideals on Math Research Workflow
item.description:
- Using mobile camera to take down lecture notes and use digikam to manage photos
- Zotero for reference manager
- Joplin for memo

item.title: Thoughts on Debian Pure Blend
item.description:
Debian Pure Blend provides an amazing amount of FOSS professional tools in almost every discipline.

You can do scientific research, process GIS data, play with medical image processing tools and listen to hamradio.

This research used to depend on large laboratory and an enormous mount of money. But now is available to all human beings, free and opensource.

item.title: Health Key Messages
item.description:
As China's interpersonal competition becomes more and more severe. Many students and researchers commit suicide. Here I present some useful resources for my own purposes:

Key Messages:
Well done! You're taking proactive steps to prioritize your mental well-being.
Reaching out for support shows real courage and resilience.
Remember, your mental health is important, and you don't have to go through this alone.
Feel free to utilize the various supports available, including professional services.
You've got this! Keep making your mental health a top priority.
